title: Stricter Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi - NDTV
summary:
Stricter Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi

Publication Date: October 25, 2023 | Source: The Commission for Air Quality Management

With dense fog enveloping Delhi and the air quality index hovering dangerously close to the 'severe' category, the Centre's anti-pollution panel has reimposed stricter pollution curbs in the capital and surrounding areas.

  • Stricter measures under GRAP-3 were revoked only recently; GRAP-4 measures have not been in effect since December 24.
  • The air quality index (AQI) has climbed to 396, likely to exceed the 400 mark.
  • Action has been taken under Stage-III and Stage-IV of the GRAP to tackle the severe air quality.
  • Restrictions include the use of certain vehicles, potential closure of physical classes, work from home measures, and bans on truck traffic.
“In an effort to prevent further deterioration of the air quality, the Sub Committee on GRAP hereby decides to straightway invoke ALL actions under Stage-III and Stage-IV of extant Schedule of GRAP...”

In conclusion, the reintroduction of these measures underscores the urgent need to address the critical air quality situation in Delhi and its adjoining regions.
newTitle: Stricter Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi

title: ED arrests former Chhattisgarh minister Kawasi Lakhma in ‘liquor scam’, he says ‘I’m illiterate, don’t know what I signed’ - The Indian Express
summary:
ED Arrests Former Chhattisgarh Minister Kawasi Lakhma in Liquor Scam

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested former Chhattisgarh excise minister Kawasi Lakhma in a multi-crore liquor scam that allegedly occurred under the previous Congress government.

  • Lakhma was questioned for several days at the ED's Raipur office before the arrest.
  • He maintains that he is innocent and claims to have cooperated with the investigation.
  • Raids were conducted at Lakhma's official residence and his son's residence.
  • Lakhma alleges that he signed papers without understanding them, due to his claim of being 'illiterate.'
  • The case involves a criminal syndicate accused of bootlegging alcohol and extorting commissions from government shops.
“Not even a single penny has been found from me but still they have arrested me. I was cooperating with them.” - Kawasi Lakhma

The case is significant as it involves 70 accused individuals, including notable government officials, and suggests a larger corruption issue in the state's excise department.
newTitle: ED Arrests Former Chhattisgarh Minister Kawasi Lakhma in Liquor Scam

title: Mumbai News Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurates ISKCON temple in Navi Mumbai’s Kharghar - The Indian Express
Centre recommends legal action against ‘individual’ accused of murder plot by US - Hindustan Times
summary:
Centre recommends legal action against individual accused of murder plot by US

Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A high-powered enquiry panel submitted its report regarding activities that threatened the security interests of both India and the United States. The investigation was prompted by allegations of a murder plot against Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun.

  • The enquiry panel was established in November 2023 after the US raised concerns about an attempted murder.
  • Vikash Yadav, identified by the US, has been linked to the failed assassination attempt.
  • The enquiry committee conducted thorough investigations, receiving full cooperation from US authorities.
  • Legal action has been recommended against an individual involved in the plot based on criminal links discovered during the investigation.
  • The committee suggested improvements in systems to enhance India’s response to such matters.
“The Committee further recommended functional improvements in systems and procedures as also initiation of steps that could strengthen India’s response capability.”

This development highlights an essential collaboration between India and the US in addressing security threats, emphasizing the importance of coordinated efforts in combating terrorism.
newTitle: Centre recommends legal action against individual accused of murder plot by the US

title: On SP backing AAP over Congress for Delhi election, Akhilesh Yadav says this - Hindustan Times
summary:
Akhilesh Yadav Backs AAP Over Congress for Delhi Elections

Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav declares support for the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over Congress in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, emphasizing the need to strengthen regional parties against the BJP.

  • The SP is prioritizing support for the strongest candidates to challenge the BJP in elections.
  • Akhilesh Yadav advocates for unity among the INDIA bloc parties to defeat the BJP.
  • He cites ongoing political tensions as part of the BJP's strategy against opposition leaders.
“We must support whichever party is strong and in a position to give a fight to BJP... our common goal is the defeat of BJP.” - Akhilesh Yadav

The ongoing alignment within the INDIA bloc demonstrates a strategic approach to maximizing electoral strength in regional contests.
newTitle: Akhilesh Yadav Backs AAP Over Congress for Delhi Elections

title: PM Modi Commissions Three Made-In-India Frontline Naval Combatants In Major Defence Boost - News18
Mahakumbh 2025 Live: 21-member foreign delegation to take holy dip in Triveni Sangam on Jan 16 - Hindustan Times
JK Police Constable Result 2025 out @ jkssb.nic.in, direct link here - Moneycontrol
summary:
JK Police Constable Result 2025 Released

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Jammu and Kashmir Services Selection Board (JKSSB) has officially released the JK Police Constable Result 2025. Candidates who took the written examination can now access their results on the official website, jkssb.nic.in.

  • The JK Police Constable exam was conducted on December 1, 8, and 22, 2024.
  • The examination format was offline and comprised 100 multiple-choice questions.
  • Candidates had a total of 2 hours to complete the exam.
  • The exam evaluated general knowledge, aptitude, and job-specific skills.
  • Each correct answer earned 1 mark, while incorrect ones incurred a 0.25 mark penalty.
“Candidates who appeared for the written examination can now access their results.”

This release is a significant milestone for candidates awaiting their results, and they are encouraged to check the official website for further details.
newTitle: JK Police Constable Result 2025 Released

title: Meet IITian Abhay Singh alias ‘Engineer Baba’, who is grabbing limelight at Mahakumbh - Hindustan Times
summary:
Meet IITian Abhay Singh alias ‘Engineer Baba’, who is grabbing limelight at Mahakumbh

Date: Jan 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Mahakumbh 2025 is currently attracting millions of devotees, and among them is ‘Engineer Baba’, a notable figure known for making spiritual concepts accessible through engineering principles.

  • Abhay Singh is a former aerospace engineering student from IIT Bombay.
  • He engages devotees with diagrams and visual presentations to explain spirituality.
  • He has a quest for knowledge that led him to explore the significance of Sanskrit and the workings of the mind.
  • Around 3.5 crore devotees joined the Mahakumbh, especially on the auspicious day of 'Makar Sankranti.'
“Science helps explain the physical world but its deeper study inevitably leads one towards spirituality. A true understanding of life ultimately brings one closer to spirituality.” - Abhay Singh

The Mahakumbh serves as a blending of modern intellect and traditional spirit, promoting the importance of spirituality among youth and professionals.
newTitle: Meet IITian Abhay Singh alias ‘Engineer Baba’ at Mahakumbh 2025

title: MHA nod to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal: What next for AAP chief? - Moneycontrol
High-powered Enquiry Committee submits report on activities of organised terror groups which undermined security interests of India, U.S. - The Hindu
summary:
High-powered Enquiry Committee submits report on activities of organised terror groups which undermined security interests of India, U.S.

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: The Hindu

A high-powered enquiry committee has submitted its findings regarding organised criminal groups and terrorist organisations that pose a threat to the security interests of both India and the U.S.

  • The investigation was prompted by allegations of a plot to assassinate Khalistani separatist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun by Indian agents.
  • The committee has recommended legal action against an individual discovered during the enquiry.
  • Cooperation from U.S. authorities was pivotal in the investigation.
  • The MHA established the committee in November 2023 following intelligence from U.S. sources.
  • The report suggests systemic improvements to enhance India's operational responses to threats.
"The Committee has further recommended functional improvements in systems and procedures as also initiation of steps that could strengthen India's response capability..."

The report addresses critical security concerns and proposes measures to bolster operational strategies in counter-terrorism efforts.
newTitle: High-powered Enquiry Committee Reports on Organised Terror Groups Threatening India-U.S. Security

title: Why India is reaching out to the Taliban now - BBC.com
summary:
Why India is Reaching Out to the Taliban Now

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: BBC News

India's latest diplomatic outreach to Afghanistan's Taliban government signals a marked shift in how it sees the geopolitical reality in the region, following the Taliban's takeover of Kabul.

  • The meeting last week was the highest level of engagement since Kabul's fall.
  • The Taliban expressed interest in strengthening ties with India, acknowledging it as a significant regional power.
  • Discussions focused on expanding trade and leveraging Iran's Chabahar port.
  • India has historically maintained extensive investments in Afghanistan exceeding $3 billion.
  • Experts highlight the complexity of engaging with a regime of a violent and brutal actor like the Taliban.
“The fact that this treatment is coming from India - a nation that never previously had friendly relations with the Taliban, makes this all the more significant.” - Michael Kugelman

India's outreach reflects its strategic interests in countering Pakistan and enhancing connectivity with Central Asia through Afghanistan.
newTitle: Why India is Reaching Out to the Taliban Now

title: BJP takes ‘mental stability’ jibe at Rahul Gandhi over his ‘fighting Indian state’ remark - Hindustan Times
Supreme Court Stays Declaration Of Result Of Bye-Election Held For Seat Of Bihar MLC Expelled Over... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Stays Results of Bihar Legislative Council Bye-Election Amid Expulsion Controversy

Publication Date: Today, Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has directed that the results of the Bihar Legislative Council Bye-Elections should not be declared following the expulsion of RJD MLC Sunil Kumar Singh over alleged defamatory remarks against Chief Minister Nitish Kumar.

  • The bye-election was called to fill the vacancy left by Sunil Kumar Singh's expulsion.
  • Justice Surya Kant noted that Singh's plea challenges the legality and fairness of his expulsion.
  • Singh's counsel argued that the charges leading to his client's expulsion lacked consistency and due process.
  • The Supreme Court will hear further arguments tomorrow regarding the case.
“If statements lead to permanent expulsion merely because objectionable as per the majority, it would end democracy.” - Dr. Abhishek Manu Singhvi

This case underscores the tension between legislative conduct and the principles of democratic discourse as the court deliberates on the merits of Singh’s case.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays Results of Bihar Legislative Council Bye-Election Amid Expulsion Controversy

title: 'Name It After Manmohan Singh': BJP Slams Congress Over Posters Outside New Headquarters - News18
summary:
BJP Challenges Congress to Honor Manmohan Singh with New Headquarters Name

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: News18

In a controversial move, BJP leaders have criticized Congress for naming its new headquarters after Indira Gandhi instead of the former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, which has sparked a public call for honoring Singh's legacy.

  • Posters outside the new Congress headquarters demand it be named 'Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhavan'.
  • BJP's Amit Malviya shared a video of the posters and criticized Congress for ignoring Singh's legacy.
  • Malviya pointed out that Rahul Gandhi's actions during Singh's mourning were disrespectful.
  • Manmohan Singh passed away at 92, and his legacy continues to be a point of political contention.
“Posters outside the new Congress headquarters call for it to be named Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhavan, as a tribute to the former Prime Minister.” - Amit Malviya

The BJP's remarks highlight the ongoing political rivalry and the importance of honoring political legacies in contemporary India.
newTitle: BJP Challenges Congress to Honor Manmohan Singh with New Headquarters Name

title: BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri compares Delhi CM Atishi with deer: ‘Hirni Jaisi Ghoom Rahi’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri Compares Delhi CM Atishi with Deer: ‘Hirni Jaisi Ghoom Rahi’

Date: Jan 15, 2025 03:19 PM IST Source: Hindustan Times

BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri has sparked controversy once again by comparing Delhi Chief Minister Atishi to a “deer” while criticizing her for not engaging with residents in her constituency.

  • Bidhuri's comments come ahead of the Delhi assembly elections scheduled for February 5.
  • He accused Atishi of ignoring the public and only making appearances during election season, saying she roams the streets like a deer.
  • This is not the first time Bidhuri has made a controversial remark about Atishi.
  • Atishi responded emotionally to Bidhuri's comments, defending her father's legacy as a teacher and condemning the attacks on her character.
  • The Delhi BJP has called for political leaders to avoid personal attacks during campaigns.
“I never thought that this country's politics could stoop so low,” - Atishi, responding to Bidhuri's remarks.

The political climate is heated as the elections approach, with both parties engaging in a war of words.
newTitle: BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri Compares Delhi CM Atishi to a Deer

title: Meta India apologises for CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s remark on 2024 elections, terms it “inadvertent error” - The Hindu
summary:
Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Comments on 2024 Elections

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Meta India has issued an apology following CEO Mark Zuckerberg's erroneous comments regarding the 2024 elections in India, which he made during a podcast, indicating the ruling government lost power.

  • Meta's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, stated the comments were an "inadvertent error".
  • Several political figures, including BJP leader Nishikant Dubey, accepted the apology, emphasizing the strong support for Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw criticized Zuckerberg's claims as misinformation.
  • India's 2024 elections saw over 640 million voters reaffirm their trust in the current government.
“A Meta India official has finally apologised for the mistake. This is a victory of the common citizens of India.” - Nishikant Dubey

The apology marks the conclusion of a political controversy, with officials expressing the importance of maintaining accurate information from prominent organizations like Meta.
newTitle: Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Comments on 2024 Elections

title: ‘Inadvertent error': Meta India apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's remark on 2024 elections - Hindustan Times
summary:
Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Remarks on 2024 Elections

Publication Date: January 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Meta India has issued an apology for comments made by CEO Mark Zuckerberg regarding the 2024 elections in India, clarifying that the remark about the incumbent government losing due to its COVID-19 handling was an 'inadvertent error'.

  • Mark Zuckerberg claimed that many incumbent governments lost elections worldwide, including India.
  • Meta India's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, emphasized India’s importance and issued the apology via a post on X.
  • BJP MP Nishikant Dubey criticized the misinformation and stated that Meta would be summoned by his committee.
  • Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw countered Zuckerberg's statement, highlighting India's successful 2024 elections with over 640 million voters.
“The people of India reaffirmed their trust in the NDA led by PM Narendra Modi's leadership.” — Ashwini Vaishnaw

This incident underscores the sensitivity surrounding misinformation and the significance of accurate statements by international figures regarding local democratic processes.
newTitle: Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Remarks on 2024 Elections

title: Rahul Gandhi on Mohan Bhagwat’s ‘true independence’ remark: ‘It’s treason’ - The Hindu
Supreme Court grants ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar interim protection from arrest - The Indian Express
summary:
Supreme Court grants ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar interim protection from arrest

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Indian Express

The Supreme Court has granted interim protection from arrest to former IAS trainee Puja Khedkar, accused of fraudulently clearing the civil services examination.

  • The Supreme Court issued a notice on her appeal against a Delhi High Court order denying bail.
  • No coercive steps can be taken against Khedkar until the next hearing on February 14.
  • Khedkar has lost her job and is pursuing legal remedies.
  • She is accused of cheating and misusing OBC and disability quota benefits.
“Prima facie, it is established that the conduct of the petitioner has been truly driven with the motive to dupe the complainant, UPSC, and all the documents arranged by her were done in order to reap benefits of schemes meant for disadvantaged groups in society.”

This decision raises questions about the implications of the case for Khedkar’s future and the integrity of civil service examinations.
newTitle: Supreme Court grants ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar interim protection from arrest

title: Rahul Gandhi says 'fighting not just BJP & RSS, but Indian State', BJP calls it 'Soros's playbook' - The Times of India
India Political Updates | Congress' ugly truth exposed: Nadda slams Rahul's 'fight against Indian State' remark - Deccan Herald
summary:
Congress' ugly truth exposed: Nadda slams Rahul's 'fight against Indian State' remark

Publication Date: 15 January 2025 Source: DH

Rahul Gandhi criticizes Mohan Bhagwat's remarks on India's independence, framing Congress's battle as against the BJP, RSS, and the Indian State.

  • Mohan Bhagwat's statement about independence and Ram Mandir sparked controversy.
  • Rahul Gandhi labeled the comments as treasonous, claiming a fight against the BJP and the Indian State.
  • Sonia Gandhi inaugurated the Congress's new HQ amidst political tensions.
  • Kejriwal dismisses life threats, attributing his safety to divine protection.
Nadda calls out Congress, stating, "Hidden no more, Congress’ ugly truth now stands exposed by their own leader."

The ongoing political conflict showcases deepening divides within Indian politics as leaders from both Congress and BJP intensify their rhetoric.
newTitle: Congress' leaders clash over allegations against BJP and RSS

title: On Mumbai visit, PM Narendra Modi meets Mahayuti MLAs over lunch, months after Maharashtra election victory - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi Meets Mahayuti MLAs Over Lunch

Date: Jan 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

During his Mumbai visit, PM Narendra Modi held a luncheon with MLAs of the BJP-led Mahayuti coalition to celebrate their significant victory in the recent Maharashtra elections.

  • Modi met MLAs at the INS Angre Auditorium in Mumbai.
  • The Mahayuti coalition won 230 out of 288 seats in the November assembly elections.
  • Key attendees included Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis and his deputies Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar.
  • Modi also commissioned three new naval combatants on the same day, highlighting India's defense progress.
  • He is scheduled to inaugurate an ISKCON temple later, emphasizing cultural promotion.
“India is swiftly progressing towards becoming the world's third-largest economy.” - PM Narendra Modi

This event signifies the Mahayuti coalition's strong political position in Maharashtra and showcases PM Modi's continued efforts in bolstering defense and cultural initiatives.
newTitle: PM Modi Meets Mahayuti MLAs in Mumbai to Celebrate Election Victory

title: Boby tenders unconditional apology, says he won't open his mouth again - Mathrubhumi English
summary:
Boby Chemmanur Apologizes to Court and Promises Silence

Publication Date: N/A Source: Mathrubhumi

Boby Chemmanur, a controversial businessman, has issued an unconditional apology before the Kerala High Court after being directed to do so, assuring the court that he will not speak on the matter again.

  • The Kerala High Court settled the case involving Chemmanur.
  • Boby's advocate described his prior statements as a 'slip of the tongue'.
  • The court warned Boby against acting like he had won an Olympic medal.
  • Boby claimed he respects the court and was not trying to 'play games' with it.
  • The court demanded an apology for what they termed 'unnecessary drama' regarding his bail release.
"Anyone with a basic understanding of the judiciary would never think of playing games with the court." - Boby Chemmanur

The situation highlighted the court's strong disapproval of Chemmanur's actions and the media attention surrounding his bail process.
newTitle: Boby Chemmanur Apologizes to Court and Promises Silence

title: J-K higher reaches likely to receive snow from tonight: MeT - Greater Kashmir
SC orders AIIMS Director to set up expert panel to examine Punjab’s reports on Dallewal’s health - The Tribune India
Supreme Court refuses to quash FIR against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court refuses to quash FIR against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race case

Published on: 15 Jan 2025, 8:06 am

The Supreme Court on Wednesday rejected the petition filed by Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA) Kalvakuntla Taraka Rama Rao seeking quashing of the first information report (FIR) lodged against him in connection with the Formula E race funding case.

  • The Supreme Court denied Rao's appeal to quash the FIR regarding the Formula E race funding.
  • Rao has been accused of criminal breach of trust and offences under the Prevention of Corruption Act.
  • The case revolves around corruption allegations in the funding by the BRS-led state government for the Formula E race in Hyderabad in 2023.
  • Rao was previously granted interim protection from arrest by the High Court but the plea was rejected after a thorough hearing.
“A prima facie case had been made out against Rao to warrant a criminal investigation.”

The Supreme Court’s decision underscores the ongoing scrutiny of public officials and the importance of accountability in public funding.
newTitle: Supreme Court Upholds FIR Against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Funding Case

title: Meta apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's Indian elections remarks: ‘Inadvertent error’ - Moneycontrol
summary:
Meta Apologizes for Mark Zuckerberg's Indian Elections Remarks: ‘Inadvertent Error’

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Meta India has issued an apology regarding comments made by Mark Zuckerberg about the Indian elections, calling them an “inadvertent error.”

  • Meta's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, acknowledged the mistake in a post.
  • The apology follows remarks by Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who labeled Zuckerberg's comments as “factually incorrect.”
  • India conducted its general elections in 2024, with over 640 million voters participating.
“We would like to apologise for this inadvertent error. India remains an incredibly important country for Meta.” - Shivnath Thukral

Meta's acknowledgment of the error underlines the platform's commitment to accuracy and the significance of India in its operational strategy.
newTitle: Meta Apologizes for Mark Zuckerberg's Comments on Indian Elections: 'Inadvertent Error'

title: Supreme Court grants interim protection from arrest to ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Grants Interim Protection from Arrest to Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar

Published on: 15 Jan 2025, 7:45 am

The Supreme Court has ordered no coercive steps against Puja Khedkar, a former IAS trainee accused of fraudulently availing reservation benefits while sitting for the UPSC exam, until further notice.

  • The Court's order comes as Khedkar appealed against the Delhi High Court's rejection of her anticipatory bail plea.
  • Khedkar is accused of misusing reservation meant for Other Backward Classes (OBC) and Persons with Benchmark Disabilities.
  • The Supreme Court issued a notice to the state and scheduled the next hearing for 14 February 2025.
  • Senior Advocate Siddharth Luthra represents Khedkar and argues for her protection claiming strong findings against her.
  • After allegations surfaced, the UPSC cancelled her selection and permanently barred her from future exams.

“If matter goes to trial there will be conviction.. there are strong findings.”

The Supreme Court's decision offers temporary respite for Khedkar as she navigates the legal challenges ahead.
newTitle: Supreme Court Grants Interim Protection from Arrest to Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar
